questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
"The Negro is still not free. The life of the Negro is still sadly crippled by the manacles of segregation and the chains of discrimination. The Negro lives on a lonely island of poverty in the midst of a vast ocean of material prosperity. The Negro is still languishing in the corners of American society and finds himself an exile in his own land. So, we have come here today to dramatize a shameful condition.... I say to you today, my friends, so even though we face the difficulties of today and tomorrow, I still have a dream. It is a dream deeply rooted in the American dream. I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: 'We hold these truths to be self-evident; that all men are created equal. I have a dream that one day on the red hills of Georgia, the sons of former slaves and the sons of former slave owners will be able to sit down together at the table of brotherhood. I have a dream that one day even the state of Mississippi, a state sweltering with the heat of injustice, sweltering with the heat of oppression, will be transformed into an oasis of freedom and justice. I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character. I have a dream today. I have a dream that one day down in Alabama, with its vicious racists, with its governor having his lips dripping with the words of 'interposition' and 'nullification', that one day right down in Alabama little black boys and black girls will be able to join hands with little white boys and white girls as sisters and brothers."

sub_questions.explanation: The text is part of a speech about the racial discrimination prevailing in the American society against the Negro.' Here the speaker says that Black people are still not free because of unfair treatment. They live in poverty while others are rich. The Black feel like strangers in their own country. Even with these struggles, the speaker has a dream. He dreams that one day, everyone will be treated as equals. He hopes that former slaves' children and former slave owners' children will live peacefully together. He dreams that every state will become fair and that  his children will be judged by their character, not by their skin color. He also hopes that black and white  children in Alabama will become friends.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following text.
The success of Kalsindur girls reads like an epic. They started their journey with practically nothing. They didn't have any boots or jerseys to wear. Initially, they played wearing salwar and kamij. They also suffered from malnutrition. What made them win against all adversities then? What was the magic behind? Mohammad Mafiz Uddin was an assistant teacher at Kalsindur Government Free Primary School where Minati Rani Sheel was the head teacher. They observed the girls' interests in football and decided to help. It was however not that easy. Girls playing football is still not a common picture in Bangladesh. Guardians were not convinced as they were used to seeing girls helping mothers with household chores. A farmer, an auto-rickshaw driver, a tea-shop owner or a housemaid mother couldn't be that ambitious either. But Minati Rani Sheel and Mohammad Mafiz Uddin persuaded them to allow their daughters to play. Being great motivators, the two teachers supported the girls in their effort to overcome the odds. They inspired them, created opportunities for them and took personal care of them. Soon the girls could prove themselves, shaking off their inhibition. Their success has also persuaded the villagers to come to their support.

sub_questions.explanation: This paragraph depicts the story and victory of Kalsindur girls. The story of Kalsindur girls is as incredible as it is heart-warming. Mohammad Mafiz Uddin, an assistant teacher at Kalsindur Government Free Primary School, and Minati Rani Sheel, the head teacher sought out to help the girls who were enthusiastic to play football. Though it is not easy for the villagers of an underdeveloped country like Bangladesh to believe that girls could play football, the teachers convinced the guardians to support their daughters in the pursuit of greatness. Finally, the girls could prove themselves and their success could persuade the villagers to support them.

questions.uddipok: The pie chart below shows the sources of air pollution in a city. Describe the pie chart in 150 words. You should make comparison where necessary.

sub_questions.explanation:
The pie chart displays the various sources of air pollution in a city, highlighting five key contributors. Vehicles are by far the most significant source, accounting for 60% of total air pollution. This indicates a heavy reliance on private and commercial transportation, possibly due to limited public transport infrastructure. Industry is the second-largest contributor at 18% , reflecting emissions from factories and manufacturing units. Power plants contribute 13% , suggesting that electricity generation—likely from fossil fuels—is another major pollutant. Waste disposal activities are responsible for 3% , while heating or using gas contributes nothing ( 0% ), showing negligible or highly controlled emissions in that category.
The disparity is stark: vehicles alone contribute more than all other sources combined, underscoring the urgent need for cleaner transport alternatives and stricter vehicular emission controls. In contrast, waste disposal and gas usage have a minimal impact, suggesting these are not major areas of concern. Targeted interventions in transport and industry could significantly improve air quality.

questions.uddipok:
The following is the beginning of a story. Complete it in your own words. Give a title to the story.
In a small village, surrounded by hills and lakes, there lived two brothers, named Jamal and Kamal. They had grown up in a humble home with their parents, learning the values of love and hard work. After their parents passed away..............

sub_questions.explanation:
Title: "The Bond Beyond Riches"
In a small village, surrounded by hills and lakes, there lived two brothers, named Jamal and Kamal. They had grown up in a humble home with their parents, learning the values of love and hard work. After their parents passed away, the brothers inherited a small piece of land and a tiny cottage.
At first, they worked together in harmony—ploughing the field, harvesting crops, and supporting each other. But soon, a rich businessman visited the village and offered to buy their land, saying it had the potential to become a tourist resort. Jamal, practical and content, wanted to continue farming. Kamal, however, dreamed of quick wealth and wanted to sell.
A rift grew. Kamal sold his share and left. Years passed. Jamal’s small farm flourished through hard work, while Kamal’s business venture failed. Broken and ashamed, Kamal returned. But Jamal, with open arms, welcomed him home.
Moral: True wealth lies in love, not land.

questions.uddipok: Write a letter to your friend congratulating him/her on his/her getting first prize in English debate competition.

sub_questions.explanation:
Subject: Congratulations on Your First Prize in the English Debate Competition!
Dear [Friend's Name],
I hope this letter finds you in high spirits and overflowing with pride, as you very much deserve to be! I was thrilled to hear the fantastic news that you clinched the first prize in the English debate competition. Heartiest congratulations on this remarkable achievement!
Your victory comes as no surprise to me, knowing your passion for debate and your exceptional skills in articulating your thoughts eloquently. Your ability to command the stage with confidence and present persuasive arguments is truly commendable. It's evident that your hard work, dedication, and countless hours of preparation have paid off splendidly.
I must say, witnessing your growth and success fills me with immense joy and inspiration. Your performance in the competition not only showcased your talent but also served as a testament to your unwavering determination and commitment to excellence. You have set a shining example for all of us to follow.
Moreover, your victory is a testament to your perseverance and resilience in the face of challenges. Engaging in debates requires not only intellectual prowess but also the courage to defend your beliefs and ideas in the face of opposition. Your ability to navigate complex arguments and present them with clarity and conviction speaks volumes about your character and determination.
As you bask in the glory of your well-deserved triumph, I want you to know that your success is an inspiration to everyone around you. Your dedication, passion, and relentless pursuit of excellence serve as a beacon of hope and encouragement to all aspiring debaters. I have no doubt that your achievement will inspire others to reach for their dreams and strive for greatness.
Once again, hearty congratulations on this outstanding accomplishment! May this victory be the first of many more to come, and may you continue to shine brightly in all your future endeavors. I look forward to celebrating many more milestones with you in the days ahead.
Wishing you continued success, happiness, and fulfillment in everything you do.
Warmest regards,
[Your Name]
